service:
Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager

With Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager, you can manage the lifecycle of your AWS resources. You create lifecycle policies, which are used to automate operations on the specified resources.

Amazon DLM supports Amazon EBS volumes and snapshots. For information about using Amazon DLM with Amazon EBS, see Automating the Amazon EBS Snapshot Lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

operations.CreateLifecyclePolicy: Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified AWS resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.
operations.DeleteLifecyclePolicy: Deletes the specified lifecycle policy and halts the automated operations that the policy specified.
operations.GetLifecyclePolicies:
Gets summary information about all or the specified data lifecycle policies.

To get complete information about a policy, use GetLifecyclePolicy.
operations.GetLifecyclePolicy: Gets detailed information about the specified lifecycle policy.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists the tags for the specified resource.
operations.TagResource: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.

refs.FastRestoreRule$AvailabilityZones: The Availability Zones in which to enable fast snapshot restore.

refs.Schedule$CopyTags: Copy all user-defined tags on a source volume to snapshots of the volume created by this policy.

refs.FastRestoreRule$Count: The number of snapshots to be enabled with fast snapshot restore.
refs.RetainRule$Count: The number of snapshots to retain for each volume, up to a maximum of 1000.

CreateRule.base: Specifies when to create snapshots of EBS volumes.

refs.Parameters$ExcludeBootVolume: When executing an EBS Snapshot Management – Instance policy, execute all CreateSnapshots calls with the excludeBootVolume set to the supplied field. Defaults to false. Only valid for EBS Snapshot Management – Instance policies.

refs.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest$ExecutionRo: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.
refs.LifecyclePolicy$ExecutionRoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.
refs.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest$ExecutionRo: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

FastRestoreRule.base: Specifies a rule for enabling fast snapshot restore. You can enable fast snapshot restore based on either a count or a time interval.

refs.LifecyclePolicy$State: The activation state of the lifecycle policy.
refs.LifecyclePolicySummary$State: The activation state of the lifecycle policy.

InternalServerException.base: The service failed in an unexpected way.

refs.CreateRule$Interval: The interval between snapshots. The supported values are 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24.
refs.FastRestoreRule$Interval: The amount of time to enable fast snapshot restore. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.
refs.RetainRule$Interval: The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

InvalidRequestException.base: Bad request. The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.

LimitExceededException.base: The request failed because a limit was exceeded.

refs.InvalidRequestException$RequiredParamete: The request omitted one or more required parameters.
refs.InvalidRequestException$MutuallyExclusiv: The request included parameters that cannot be provided together.

Parameters.base: Optional parameters that can be added to the policy. The set of valid parameters depends on the combination of policyType and resourceType values.

refs.PolicyDetails$Parameters: A set of optional parameters that can be provided by the policy.

refs.LifecyclePolicy$PolicyArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

refs.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest$Description: A description of the lifecycle policy. The characters ^[0-9A-Za-z _-]+$ are supported.

PolicyDetails.base: Specifies the configuration of a lifecycle policy.

refs.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest$PolicyDetai: The configuration details of the lifecycle policy.
refs.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest$PolicyDetai: The configuration of the lifecycle policy. You cannot update the policy type or the resource type.

refs.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest$PolicyIds: The identifiers of the data lifecycle policies.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$ResourceIds: Value is a list of resource IDs that were not found.

refs.PolicyDetails$PolicyType: This field determines the valid target resource types and actions a policy can manage. This field defaults to EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT if not present.

RetainRule.base: Specifies the retention rule for a lifecycle policy. You can retain snapshots based on either a count or a time interval.

refs.FastRestoreRule$IntervalUnit: The unit of time for enabling fast snapshot restore.
refs.RetainRule$IntervalUnit: The unit of time for time-based retention.

refs.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest$State: The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.
refs.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest$State: The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.

refs.LimitExceededException$ResourceType: Value is the type of resource for which a limit was exceeded.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$ResourceType: Value is the type of resource that was not found.

refs.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest$Tags: The tags to apply to the lifecycle policy during creation.

refs.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest$TagsToAdd:
The tags to add to objects created by the policy.

Tags are strings in the format key=value.

These user-defined tags are added in addition to the AWS-added lifecycle tags.

refs.Schedule$TagsToAdd: The tags to apply to policy-created resources. These user-defined tags are in addition to the AWS-added lifecycle tags.

refs.PolicyDetails$TargetTags: The single tag that identifies targeted resources for this policy.

refs.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest$TargetTags:
The target tag for a policy.

Tags are strings in the format key=value.

refs.CreateRule$Times:
The time, in UTC, to start the operation. The supported format is hh:mm.

The operation occurs within a one-hour window following the specified time.

refs.LifecyclePolicy$DateCreated: The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was created.
refs.LifecyclePolicy$DateModified: The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was last modified.

refs.Schedule$VariableTags: A collection of key/value pairs with values determined dynamically when the policy is executed. Keys may be any valid Amazon EC2 tag key. Values must be in one of the two following formats: $(instance-id) or $(timestamp). Variable tags are only valid for EBS Snapshot Management – Instance policies.
